intro: Myzorrhiza ludoviciana, commonly known as the Texas lantana, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is characterized by its aromatic, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant has opposite, narrow leaves and produces small, berry-like fruits that are edible for some bird species. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and disturbed areas. Myzorrhiza ludoviciana plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening.
